data.title: Rice farmers to get help with harvest costs
data.description: The government is preparing to scrap a much-criticised  fertiliser  co-payment scheme and replace it with a new programme aimed at reducing  rice farmers ‚Äô harvest costs, according to Agriculture Minister Narumon Pinyosinwat.

data.title: AAI Reports 283% Profit Growth, Eyes Continued Expansion¬†
data.description: Asian Alliance International Public Company Limited (AAI), a leading Thai pet food manufacturer, reported outstanding Q3/2024 performance, with revenue growth of 37.8% and a net profit increase of 145% compared to the same period last year. This was driven by increased demand in pet food business, which remains the primary growth driver. For the first nine months of this year, net profit surged by 283.4% compared to the same period last year, reflecting strong demand from major brand clients who launched new products tailored to owners seeking specialised pet food. The gross profit margin remains within the target of 20-21%. The company is confident that total revenue for this year will meet the target of THB 6,500 million, comprising THB 5,700 million from pet food business and THB 800 million from human shelf-stable food. Production capacity expansion plans are progressing as expected. In August, the company commenced dry pet food production under the ‚ÄúPro‚Äù brand and expanded capacity for canned and pouch-packed products, which will increase wet pet food production to 59,000 tons per year by Q1 next year.

data.title: Putin ‚Äòopen to Ukraine truce talks with Trump‚Äô
data.description: MOSCOW ‚Äî Russian President Vladimir Putin is open to discussing a Ukraine ceasefire deal with Donald Trump but rules out making any major territorial concessions and insists Kyiv abandon ambitions to join NATO, five sources with knowledge of Kremlin thinking told Reuters.

data.title: DTGO and Huawei Launch Thai-Capable AI Language Model¬†
data.description: Huawei Cloud and DTGO Corporation Limited (DTGO), a leading business group focused on social and environmental impact, have unveiled the world‚Äôs first large language model (LLM) designed for efficient performance in Thai, Chinese, and English. This groundbreaking innovation, DTLM, was launched on 18 November 2024 and developed using Huawei Cloud‚Äôs Ascend AI computing service. It aims to  revolutionise business functions such as management, customer service, and data analysis for organisations across Thailand.

data.title: Thaioil Achieves "Excellent" CGR Rating for 16th Consecutive Year¬†
data.description: Thai Oil Public Company Limited ( Thaioil) has earned an ‚ÄúExcellent CGR Rating‚Äù for the 16th consecutive year, signified by the prestigious 5-symbol distinction‚Äîthe highest level of recognition. The company is also ranked within the top quartile of listed companies with a market capitalisation of no less than 10 billion baht.

data.title: Chiang Mai golden tigresses attract visitors
data.description: Chiang Mai Night Safari has introduced the three-year-old  golden tiger  Eva, who has quickly become a favourite on social media alongside her sister Luna.

data.title: Cyanide killer gets death sentence
data.description: The Criminal Court has given the death sentence to a woman suspected of killing 14 people with cyanide and found guilty of murdering one, a friend, during a merit-making trip last year.

data.title: Fresh Off the Runway: Jaspal Group‚Äôs 2024 Scholarship Winners¬†
data.description: Jaspal Group solidifies its status as a leader in the fashion industry, driving Thailand‚Äôs fashion landscape forward with the Jaspal Group Scholarship  Programme 2024. Going beyond the award ceremony, the group hosted a captivating runway show that spotlighted the innovative designs of this year‚Äôs winners. Themed ‚ÄúThe Power of Next,‚Äù the programme provided a platform for young designers nationwide to unleash their creativity, breathing fresh energy into Jaspal Group‚Äôs iconic brands.

data.title: Japan sets monthly visitor record
data.description: TOKYO - Japan welcomed a record 3.31 million foreign visitors last month, official data showed on Wednesday, as the weak yen propelled a tourism boom that is pouring money into the country‚Äôs coffers.

data.title: Seven killed in crash while fleeing police
data.description: Seven  foreign workers  were  killed  when their pickup truck struck a power pole and plunged into a ditch while their driver was  fleeing police  in Nakhon Pathom.

data.title: Bangchak Executive Highlights ASEAN Carbon Market Vision
data.description: Gloyta Nathalang, Senior Executive Vice President of Sustainability Management and Corporate Communications at Bangchak Corporation and Chairperson of the Carbon Markets Club, took the stage at COP29 in Baku, Azerbaijan, to lead discussions on advancing the ASEAN carbon market. Representing Bangchak at two pivotal side event panels, she emphasised the need for regional cooperation and technological innovation to drive sustainable development.

data.title: Third phase of handout to cost B140 billion
data.description: The Thai government expects to carry out the third phase of its cash  handout  stimulus programme in the second quarter next year, when 140 billion baht will be distributed to 14 million people, according to Deputy Finance Minister Julapun Amornvivat.

data.title: Porsche World Roadshow Returns to Thailand's Tracks
data.description: Pathum Thani . It has long been said that the best way to experience a Porsche is behind the steering wheel; that is why the exhilarating Porsche World Roadshow (PWRS) is making a highly-anticipated return to Thailand after two years at the Pathum Thani Speedway.

data.title: IRPC Oil Renews Membership in Anti-Corruption Initiative
data.description: IRPC Oil has reaffirmed its commitment to integrity and transparency by renewing its membership in the Thai Private Sector Collective Action Against Corruption (CAC).
